bike1.description: One fine day our kid trailer collected, more or less by accident, Felix's best friend Jasper.
bike1.title: Bike 1

bike2.description: Jasper and Felix have been constant companions at the Snuggery for a few months.  It's the hardest part of moving him to a new school.  We'll definitely be having playdates since Jasper only lives a few blocks away.
bike2.title: Bike 2

food.description: Milo's developed an interest in using utensils.  Dean gives him some pointers.
food.title: Food

parade1.description: Independence Day.   Not wanting another year of foggy fireworks, we headed inland to Danville, California.  We got hot summer weather and classic small town America.
parade1.title: Parade 1

parade4.description: The army reserves deployed their bellies.
parade4.title: Parade 4

parade5.description: We were in Danville because our friend Amy grew up there.   She was even a cheerleader at Danville High.   Topside is her son Wyatt.
parade5.title: Parade 5

parade6.description: The air force deployed their lone remaining Vietnam helicopter.
parade6.title: Parade 6

parade7.description: Captain America graciously took time from his hectic crime-fighting schedule.
parade7.title: Parade 7

parade8.description: Milo, a bit sick, seemed dubious of the whole deal but at least he was willing to people-watch and whack Dean with a flag.
parade8.title: Parade 8

parade9.description: Nobody stuck their toes in the parade route.
parade9.title: Parade 9

parade9b.description: Every small town has a crack lawn care team ready to parade at a moment's notice.
parade9b.title: Parade9b

summer1.description: After the parade we did summery things at Wyatt's house.   Dean loved the Slip & Slide, but the under 5 set wasn't so bold.  In fact, it scared Milo to tears to see Dean on it.
summer1.title: Summer 1

description:
Felix started his new school, the New School of Berkeley, on Friday. It's going well. The teachers are all very cool and there are lots of things to do. Felix's class even has a pet rat that crawls all over them! Felix hasn't made friends yet, but he understands it can take time. He's showing a lot of good will.

Lucie, Felix and Milo have been a little sick. Milo is teething. Despite it all, we had a first rate 4th of July in a small and wholesome little town called Danville.

New words and baby signs this week:
  • boo!: as in "peekaboo". Milo LOVES playing peekaboo. He hides behind a door then opens it and goes "boo!!!"
  • papa: No doubt about it now, he really means Dean when he says it.
  • [flapping one arm]: bird.
  • [toungue in and out of mouth]: frog. In the process of learning this sign, Milo discovered his toungue. He was fascinated.
title: July 4
